definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to measure
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Yes, many want government to start living within its means.
sentences.chinese: 是的，许多人都希望政府开始量入为出。

sentences.english: We have to contrive to live on our own income.
sentences.chinese: 我们的生活必需设法量入为出。

definition: lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending/to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure
meticulous planning and careful accounting (idiom)
lit. eating away next year's food in advance/fig. to dip into the next month's check/live now, pay later
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
to deposit money/to save/savings
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth
excessive consumption/overspending on luxuries
storing grain against a famine/to lay sth by for a rainy day/also written 積穀防飢|积谷防饥
lit. moonlight group/fig. those who spend their monthly income even before they earn their next salary (slang)
to deposit money/to save money
frugal/economical
to assess one's capabilities and act accordingly (idiom); to act within one's competence/One does what one can.
financial management/finance
diligent and thrifty (idiom)
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
